data.title: incorrect auto-formatting of parentheses after the arguments on a new line
Move cursor X amount of lines to the top or the bottom
data.body: If we use the key cmd+up or cmd+down the cursor will go to the top or the bottom of the file, is there a way to move the cursor X amount of lines to the top or the bottom?, like go up 5 lines or 10 lines.

data.title: JSDoc syntax highlight. Not supported 'Array of Arrays'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/21553116/8514a250-ce17-11e6-9bd2-217cd2c7fd4c.png)

- OS Version: Linux Mint 18

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write code:
```js
/* jshint esnext:true */

/**
 * @param {Array<string>} a1
 * @param {Array<Array<string>>} a2
 */
function myFunc(a1, a2) {

}
```
2. See that:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/21552987/80c6fef6-ce16-11e6-82f9-c59be5d9fc60.png)

3. Yes, it's correct
https://github.com/google/closure-compiler/wiki/Types-in-the-Closure-Type-System#types-in-javascript
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/21553061/17c4a088-ce17-11e6-980e-0829946039bc.png)

data.title: Regression in completion provider
Add babelrc schema
data.body:
The json extension defines .bablerc as an extension for JSON file.

Since there also is a schema for .babelrc (schemastore/src/schemas/json/babelrc.json) the JSON extension should also define the schema for .bablerc files.

data.title: Visual Studio Code strange bug in extensions GUI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Suddenly VSCode started to show the extensions as follows:

![111111](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/177999/21550689/9287928e-ce04-11e6-95c7-be633cc49657.png)

And this is how extension panel looks normaly:
![extension-gallery_extensions-popular](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/177999/21550752/0af1da90-ce05-11e6-97d5-1d702c07b553.png)


You can see - no extension image, no downloaded count icon, no rating stars!!! Just yesterday it was normal. No settings added/removed/edited, no new extensions installed.

Also i did VSCode uninstall and ~/.vscode and ~/.config/Code removed. Then install again with Ubuntu Software Center ... the problem is still there.

Is there any VS Code bug?

data.title: Snippet expansion does not respect tabstops
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1 (1.8.1)
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new snippet (e.g. for language javascript (babel)).
2. Define a body with multiple tabstops. E.g.

		"Arrow Function": {
			"prefix": "arrow",
			"body": [
				"${1:($2)} => {$0}"
			],
			"description": "An ES6 arrow function"
		}

3. Open a file with the specific language and expand the snippet. 
4. Try to tab to each of the stops.

![snippetissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2437424/21549319/14f1109a-cdb7-11e6-8278-bbee63544b25.gif)

The snippet expands and it looks like the first tabstop is respected but the rest are not. 

I've tried this in several language snippet files, with and without placeholders, and with and without the vim extension installed. I get the same result in any case. 

Please let me know if you need any other information. I'm loving VSCode (seriously, you guys took a previously anti-MS person and switched him(me) over from vim and sublime as my go to editors) and I'm ok living with this issue at the moment. It would just make it that much better if the tabstops worked as expected.

data.title: Merge powerzen mode funtionality into vscode
data.body:
Currently with the extension there are the following limitations

1. Two trigger zen mode commands get registered (an extension can not unregister a command)
2. We have removed the fullScreen zen mode funtionality from vscode

We have two options:
1. Move all of the power zen mode funitionality into vscode
2. Still support fullScreen setting for a month and depreacte it

Due to the ugliness of two trigger zen mode commands and after discussing with Joh I am prefering option 1.

fyi @jrieken @bpasero

data.title: TypeScript doesn't replace half overwrite properly anymore
data.body: * open a TypeScript file * type `cConsole` * trigger IntelliSense, select `console` * 🐛 text turns int `cconsole` instead of `console`, debugger shows that the suggestion isn't overwriting enough (`overwriteBefore: 6`)

data.title: Syntax highlighting broken following ES6 spread operator
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider commit 9486b4
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an ES6 class using `extends` and add `super(...args)`
2. Observe lack of highlighting after `super(...args)`
3. Profit

Just noticed it this morning on insider build.

Update  - affects any use of spread operator

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/573056/21546518/3c45a28c-cdad-11e6-9c76-fc41eba35cab.png)

data.title: Feature request: show only folded region
data.body:
I use [this](http://tibleiz.net/code-browser/index.html) editor because it supports folding in a unique way that I haven't seen elsewhere: it allows you to see only a specific fold, basically making it look like it's the only thing in the entire file.

I would *love* to have this ability in vscode and I'd like to write an extension that allows it. I have been looking at the docs but I am not sure where to start so I thought I'd ask in here if it seems at all possible with the currently exposed APIs and architecture? And if so, what would be some pointers as to where I should start?

data.title: [FR][Terminal] allow addons to be added/enable/disable
data.body:
xterm.js already have a few interested addons.The one that would be especially useful for vscode is the linkify one.

Would be great to have the possibility to enable that addon from the API. The same it would be great for extensions to be able to add their own custom xterm addons.

Related discussion: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17678

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|0.0.12|
|rest-client|humao|0.11.2|
|vs-color-picker|lihui|0.3.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.3.0|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.3.8|

---

Since last update to 1.8.1 it takes certain minutes (> 10) to open a file or folder.
I normally start the editor and open a folder using "File -> Open Folder".
The exporer window does'nt even appear.

I've also disabled all of the above mentioned plugin and tried to reinstall VS Code but that led to no success.

Any other editor action is fast and does not cause a delay. If i run "code ." in my cmd it'll open my current folder immediately.

data.title: TextFileEditorModelManager disposes models it doesn't own
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/actions.ts#L56
2. Right click on `closeEditor`, click Find all references
3. `Cmd+Click` on references in `editorService`, the file containing that reference will be opened on the right side editor group.
4. Expand references tree, part of the references are rendered as blank somtimes

Gif demonstrating the steps:
![reference-blank](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/21532696/75665eb8-cd07-11e6-9f37-0a7c9d95a101.gif)

It's not that easy to reproduce, you might need to run step 4 several times.

2. Enter some texts
3. Close VS Code

data.title: Expose language display names to extension API
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Irrelevant

Currently it seems it is not possible to get the name of the language of a document in an extension. The document object contains a property `languageId` which has an internal ID for the language. `vscode.languages.getLanguages()` can also be used to get all registered language IDs. There is no method to get the actual names of the languages.

The editor displays the name of the language in the status bar and in the language mode menu, but the names are not exposed to extensions. Personally I am working on an extension for my web service which requires the actual language names and not the IDs.
